title.narrative: ASMed- Dagli Appennini allo Shouf: migrazioni di esperienze e conoscenze attraveso il mediterraneo

description.narrative: THE INITIATIVE PROMOTES A NEW PROGRAMMATIC AND PARTECIPATORY APROACHFOR THE SUSTEINABLE MANAGEMENT OF THE TERRITORY AND THE NATURAL RESOURCES (NR) AND FOR TE PROMOTION OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, RECOGNIZED AS A MODEL TO FIGHT CLIMATE CHANGE.

l'INIZIATIVA PROMUOVE UN APPROCCIO PROGRAMMATICO E PARTECIPATIVO PER LA GESTIONE SOSTENIBILE DEL TERRITORIO E DELLE RISORSE NATURALI (RM) E PER LA PROMOZIONE DI OPPORTUNITA' ECONOMICHE, APPROCCIO RICONOSCIUTO COME MODELLO PER CONTRASTARE IL CAMBIAMENTO CLIMATICO.

organisation.narrative: AICS - Italian Agency for Cooperation and Development

sector.narrative: PUBLIC SECTOR POLICY AND ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT
WATER SECTOR POLICY AND ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT

tag.narrative: By 2030, enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management in all countries

By 2030, expand international cooperation and capacity-building support to developing countries in water- and sanitation-related activities and programmes, including water harvesting, desalination, water efficiency, wastewater treatment, recycling and reuse technologies
Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable

Promote mechanisms for raising capacity for effective climate change-related planning and management in least developed countries and small island developing States, including focusing on women, youth and local and marginalized communities
Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries
Support and strengthen the participation of local communities in improving water and sanitation management
Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
